[Using WTP M5 build]

Note: I've queried WTP CVS but havn't found a matching bug - surprising as I
thought someone else would have noticed this.

If I create a Tomcat 5 Server (any type would do) and then create a new (empty)
Dynamic Web Project, when I use the context menu->Run As->Run On Server wizard,
select the server and hit finish, the workbench console dumps the exception
below - it appears SWT doesn't like it doing what it is doing oustide the
display thread.  Sorry, I'm not very familiar with SWT so can't offer much by
way of a solution. If it helps any, at

org.eclipse.wst.server.ui.internal.wizard.page.TasksComposite(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget).checkWidget()
line: 298  (see stack below) 

the two variables compared have the following values (when I debug)
display.thread = Thread  (id=1) 
  toString() = "Thread[main,6,main]"

Thread.currentThread ()= ModalContext$ModalContextThread  (id=1209)
  toString() = "Thread[ModalContext,6,main]"

I'm not sure what the side effect is as the workbench does continue to publish.  

(The WorkspaceRunnableAdapter below is created and run at TaskWizard:218)
